title: Automate news ingestion from Eenadu, Sakshi, and Andhra Jyothy

requirements.text: Extend the backend auto-fetch HTTP outcall logic to fetch and parse articles from https://www.eenadu.net/, https://www.sakshi.com/, and https://www.andhrajyothy.com/ — attempt RSS feed endpoints (e.g., /rss, /feed, /rss.xml) for each domain. For each source, extract article title, summary, URL, category, author, and publication date, then store them as News records, deduplicating by URL so re-fetching does not create duplicates.

quotes: Please automata to add articles from https://www.eenadu.net/,https://www.sakshi.com/,https://www.andhrajyothy.com/ and add into our website.

acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor exposes a function (or extends the existing autoFetchNews function) that fetches from all three sources: eenadu.net, sakshi.com, and andhrajyothy.com.
Articles fetched from each source are stored as News records with correct title, summary, sourceUrl, category, and date fields.
Duplicate articles (same URL) are not inserted more than once regardless of how many times the fetch is triggered.
Fetch failures from one source do not prevent successful ingestion from the other sources.

requirements.text: Update the Admin dashboard (AdminPage.tsx) to support triggering auto-fetch from all three sources — Eenadu, Sakshi, and Andhra Jyothy — either individually via per-source buttons or collectively via a single 'Fetch All Sources' button. Display the fetch status and result count (articles added) for each source after execution.

quotes: Please automata to add articles from https://www.eenadu.net/,https://www.sakshi.com/,https://www.andhrajyothy.com/ and add into our website.

acceptanceCriteria: Admin page shows controls to trigger news fetch from Eenadu, Sakshi, and Andhra Jyothy (individually or as a group).
After fetching, the UI displays how many new articles were added per source.
Loading states are shown while a fetch is in progress.
Error messages are displayed per source if the fetch fails.

requirements.text: Update the useQueries.ts React Query hooks to include mutation or query hooks for the new multi-source auto-fetch backend function(s), ensuring cache invalidation for the news article list after successful ingestion.
acceptanceCriteria: A hook exists in useQueries.ts for triggering multi-source fetch (eenadu, sakshi, andhrajyothy).
On successful fetch, the news article list query cache is invalidated so the UI reflects newly added articles without a manual page refresh.

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
All backend logic must remain in the single actor in backend/main.mo.
Deduplication by article URL must be enforced in the backend to prevent duplicate entries on repeated fetches.
nonGoals: Real-time or webhook-based article ingestion — polling/manual trigger only.
Scraping full article body HTML from source websites.
Any changes to article display layout or card components.
